files.description: Tiny JSONL annotation fixture containing a mix of valid rows and intentionally invalid rows to exercise taxonomy validation paths.
Implements a JSONL annotation validator that checks each record against the taxonomy/schema rules and returns per-record errors plus a pass/fail summary.
CLI runner that loads the JSONL fixture, invokes the validator, and writes the summary and per-record errors to runtime/_build/reports/taxonomy_validation.json with a nonzero exit code on failure.
Keeps the reports output directory in version control so CI and local runs can reliably write taxonomy_validation.json.
Adds a runnable script entry (e.g., taxonomy:validate) that executes scripts/run_taxonomy_validation.js and can be invoked by the test runner and CI.
Updates CI to run the taxonomy validation script and upload runtime/_build/reports/taxonomy_validation.json as an artifact on every build.

missionDescription: Create a tiny annotation JSONL fixture (valid + intentionally invalid rows), run the validator, and save a pass/fail summary plus per-record errors into runtime/_build/reports/taxonomy_validation.json; wire into the runner and CI.
